Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay near the airport, but you can probably do better.”
Reviews.Author: Flyinlow427vette
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on business. The hotel appeared to be a little worn out and did not have that fresh, clean feeling. The carpet on the steps for instance, was clearly worn. The best thing about this hotel was the breakfast, which had something for everyone. Better selection than most Hampton Inn's I frequent. The hotel had an indoor pool. I thought the hotel was relatively quiet despite the proximity to the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: Tracy g
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed one night. Arrived to a cozy lobby with a fireplace. Our room was a good size for 4. Everything was clean but the carpet. You could see the filth on the carpet and it was sticky to walk on. Beds were nice but need new pillows! We awoke to find that 3 vehicles had their windows smashed out. It seemed like a nice area with a subdivision on one side. If we have to go back to Indy I would not choose to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet Room”
Reviews.Author: cobble
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Carlson Chains several times this year and selected this hotel based on recent reviews and past experiences with Carlson. The room was very spacious and included comfortable lounge and desk chairs. The only thing that surprised us was that there was no fridge & microwave in the room...(the first time we've not had one at the Carlson hotels we've stayed at). My husband asked the manager about it and he said they are not included in a "standard room" there; he did graciously offer to move us to a room that had a fridge and microwave. We declined since we were there for just one night but appreciated his offer. Breakfast was good, the room was clean and staff were exceedingly friendly. We wouldn't hesitate to stay again but would ask for a room that included the appliances next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SWATChasers
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business (work in the media) and I am a big fan of the Carlson Chains including Country Inn & Suites. When I checked into the hotel, the front of the hotel and lobby were in perfect condition. On my way to my second floor suite, the hallways and stairs were also extremely clean. The room was beyond excellent and was completely clean. I even checked the small corners, and everything was in top shape. The suite I stayed in had two rooms and offered plenty of space. The flat screen television was appreciated. The bathroom was clean and the shower was easy to regulate. The bed was extremely comfortable and I slept quite well. I never got in the pool but I did use the hot tub on several occasions and it was a little cool for my liking, but was still comfortable. Breakfast was amazing for a free continental breakfast with waffles, sausage, eggs, biscuits and gravy and a large assortment of pastries, baked goods, cereals and fruit. My only complaint was that the WIFI was a little slow. I tried all of the available networks in the hotel and could never get a good fast connection. Otherwise though, this was an amazing hotel experience and I would recommend the Country Inn and Suites Indianapolis Airport South to anyone. I'm hoping to stay there on my next trip to Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Country Inn & Suites, but that isn't a bad thing”
Reviews.Author: dale3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Country Inn for two nights in October and found that overall the property was very good and consistent with other Country Inns. The hotel did tell us when we checked in that a large FFA convention was in town and several high school students were staying at the hotel, but we never heard any loud noises late at night, but it was nice of them to inform us. The room, the service and the breakfast were typically Country Inn & Suites. We stay often at these type of hotels because we usually have a good experience at Country Inn & Suites. Was initially concerned about possible noise from the airport, but we heard no airplane noise the whole time were were there. If you need to stay in this area, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again for sure”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: I usually don't stay in hotels unless they are 100% smoke free so I was reluctant about staying here. I was pleasantly surprised how clean and fresh the hotel is. The decor is typical Country Inn and very nice. The breakfast was great and staff accommodating. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, affordable!”
Reviews.Author: BlueSpecV
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our stay here. The rooms were clean, the beds were super comfortable, and it only cost $80 tax Inc. A+ recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was o.k....”
Reviews.Author: vintagebeachbum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night while passing through. All was fine, room smelled o.k. and appeared to be clean. Had cookies from the front desk upon arrival and cocoa - which was nice on a cold night. Temperature in shower was hard to regulate. Didn't get breakfast since we had to leave before it was ready - they do not open it early for early travelers, left the lights off to discourage those wanting to take something for the road. One mishap - was given room at check-in that was already occupied so we walked into someone else's room - ugh.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Terrific Staff”
Reviews.Author: jmy70
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 8/14 till 9/7. To start with the rooms are very clean and modern. They have a continental breakfast that surpasses most other hotels. The hotel also has an indoor pool that was open from 8am till midnight and a hot tub as well. The staff was fantastic at making my stay as pleasant as possible especially the manager Paul who helped get us a fridge for our room. There are many places to chhose from to eat all within a 10 mile radius. Overall i would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice clean room with great amenities at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Nancy W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and quiet. Staff was friendly and helpful. They had a much better continental breakfast than most places,.

Reviews.Title: “Convience, nice place overall”
Reviews.Author: Boardumb
Reviews.Content: Staying here for 5 weeks through work. When myself and 4 other coworkers arrived the first night, we came to find out we didn't have fridges or microwaves like HR stated through our work. After a quick call, the staff arranged so we could put anything we needed chilled in the kitched fridge for the night while they sourced rooms for us to all switch to the next day. Breakfast is decent. A little variety once in a while with French Toast instead of eggs. Sausage links, potatoes, and/or sausage patties are often. Waffles are better if you leave them in another 10-15 sec after the timer goes off, haha.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel to everyone”
Reviews.Author: Dawn A
Reviews.Content: Recently my husband and I were in Indianapolis to scope out the area for my husband’s job transfer in November. Our very first impression of the area came from our stay and accommodations at the Country Inn. Firstly the hotel exceeded expectations on it warmth and cleanliness. The staff was very helpfully in helping us find our way around town. The general manager was especially helpful and gave us some great tips on how to navigate around the highway construction. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone I talk too and looking forward to our next stay there in November.

Reviews.Title: “Will never use another hotel in Indy!”
Reviews.Author: ttarashell
Reviews.Content: The main reason we went with Country Inn & Suites is because of the shuttle service to the airport and the amentities. Kids loved the pool and all the pillows (2 girls, 6 and 2) When our flight arrived only took 15 minutes for the shuttle to arrive and both drivers were great!! We will ALWAYS use this location!! Left our vehicle for 7 days and no problems!!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you have money for a deposit!!!”
Reviews.Author: chrwmcayke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Indy for the Brickyard 400 and stayed at this hotel from 7/30 until 8/01. When I went to check in, I knew I had enough money in the bank to use my debit card for the room. That went thru okay but the lady at the counter said it came back with a code 25 because I didnt have enough money for the deposit. I told her the website did not state anything about a deposit. She rudely asked me if I had another card to use for the deposit and I told her no. She went to her manager and came back and said they would take $75 cash for the deposit. I said that I didnt have the extra money to give for a deposit. As new customers came into the lobby, the manager came over and said that if I gave them $40 cash that would be accepted. It hurt my wallet to do that but I really had no other choice since all of the other hotels we looked at were book up. Then the manager said that he could take the $40 cash and apply it to my bill so that the deposit would go back onto my card in 5 days. I told him that was unacceptable and then he rudely told me that I could get it back after I check out but he would have to hand write a receipt. I told him thats whats he's gonna do if he wants our business because I cant afford to wait for $40 to go back to my card. He appologized to the new customers behind us for the wait but didnt say anything to me and my husband. I didnt want the hassel of looking for another place since we were there so we just stuck it out. The beds were lumpy and the pillows were way too soft and flat. Plus my husband had to go down to the front desk to ask for shampoo, conditioner and soap because the non-english speaking housekeeper did not stock the bathroom. The pool had too much chlorine in it and the water tasted salty. I would say this is an ok place if you are passing thru town and wanna crash for the night but other than that, I would say keep on trucking down the road til you find a different place.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE HAS BEEN A GOD SEND TO MY FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: angiezitscher
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying here pretty much on a monthly basis for the last 5 years. The staff has gone the extra step to make sure that visits with our developmentally disabled son has been great. The hotel is clean, beds are comfortable, and they have a variety of rooms. I recommend the family or king suites if you spend a lot of your time in the room.The staff remember us by name. They are very friendly and attentive to the needs of their guests. I know that they have vans running regularly to and from the airport. Bottomline, it is extremely comfortable staying at this hotel, and the prices are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed opinion of this Country Inn”
Reviews.Author: FreindsofMishka
Reviews.Content: We were treated very well at check in and were given a nice fairly roomy suite. The room showed signs of age and neglect in maintenance and was of an age that remodeling is indicated fairly soon. We reported the battery had been removed from the smoke detector in the bedroom area and another appeared missing in the outer room, wires showing in a hole in the ceiling. Nothing was done about it while we were there which was a little disturbing. We stay at many Country Inns and really like this franchise and on the whole liked this stay but the room was in decline. We would still recommend it with the strong advice to check if the smoke detectors were present and working.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, great breakfast, nice room”
Reviews.Author: theoldtimer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night in between our 1400 miles round-trip drive between Bloomington and New Jersey. This is our second stay in this chain. Our first stay was in Canadian side of Niagara Falls. The facility is very clean and staff are very friendly and efficient. We were offered an upgraded suite (on the opposite side of the highway) with a king size bed from our reservation of two queen beds because no double-queen room is available opposite to the highway. We chose to stay in the double-queen room so kids can have a queen bed for themselves. As other people point out, there is some noise from the highway. If you are sensitive to noise, bring a pair of ear plugs. Breakfast has a lot of varieties and is hot and fresh. We will recommend this hotel to anyone who goes to Indianapolis. BTW, take advantage of the big discount if you can book at least two weeks in advance on hotel chain website.

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose for half the night-smoke smell woke us up for the other half!”
Reviews.Author: rcg2
Reviews.Content: This seemed to be an average hotel upon arriving. We went swimming and then to bed. At 4:30 we woke up to a horrible smoke/burning smell. Needless to say, we didn't sleep the rest of the night because we were worried that we'd all burn up! We called the front desk around 5:00 and they said it must just be the oven. However, the hallway and downstairs didn't smell at all. So I'm not sure how it could be the oven. When you're on a roadtrip, you need a good night's sleep. I would have enjoyed sleeping the ENTIRE night.

Reviews.Title: “Indy 500 Time Trials Stay”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne B
Reviews.Content: People very nice, Pretty good breakfast! Hot food hot, and normal muffins, cereal, yogurt, hot oatmeal, waffles!, etc. Very clean! Willdefiantely stay here again! We had 4 rooms, 2 Double Queens, 1 King and 1 suite. all were comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Love the pool and the great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: OfficialGottaGo
Reviews.Content: The personnel were fabulous and they really took care of myself with a ride to the airport. Check out the great park and fly rates ! My kids and husband loved the breakfast and pool. I accidently forgot to give my husband the keys to the car before I fly out. Everyone at the hotel went above and beyond to help my husband locate me and the keys to our car. Everyone at the hotel is wonderful !

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Room 318”
Reviews.Author: OhioPookster
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 2Q w/ pull out sofa for a soccer tournament. We love Country Inn and Suites as we have a larger than typical family and need the room. The smoke detector and sprinkler system went off at 1:30 am. The sprinkler did not spray but dripped all over the floor. After going to the lobby to find out who could help, I was informed the driver I am assuming for the airport would be coming up to investigate. After close to 5 minutes, he arrived with an attitude. The alarm continued to sound and the sprinkler continued to drip with 4 sons in the room. The alarm was disconnected. I asked to be moved. Seriously? I had to ask? - and was told I could stay in there for the night. UMMMMM> NOT! It is not safe nor following the law. No working smoke detectors with a floor wet enough to be dripping down to the first floor is not acceptable. We moved our things - alone - at 2 am. We were not contacted by management with any type of apology and paid the rate for the room per night. We were there for 2 nights and this was the first. Extremely poor customer service by management. The day staff was willing to go the extra mile and was very friendly. I did check to see if the room was rerented and was told the room was out of service thankfully.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: wodart
Reviews.Content: This budget hotel was clean, comfortable and convenient to the airport. Service staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast weas about average for moderately-priced chain hotelsd - adequate but not memorable. There are not many restaurants for dinner in the immediate vicinity, but El Rodeo on Heathrow Way was excellent. We would gladly stay at this hotel again if we needed a place close to airport.

Reviews.Title: “You won't sleep if you stay here”
Reviews.Author: MAKay
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I have had a good experience at all other hotels in this chain. Unfortunately, because this hotel is built extremely close to the freeway off/on ramp, it was impossible to sleep. The noise level was unreal. And all night long. Having the air conditioner might have provided some white noise, but it emitted a constant clicking sound from the fan. Complained at the desk to be told there was nothing they could do.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable - Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: WrightFive
Reviews.Content: I have had such varying degrees of service from this hotel. We have stayed there more than once and have had problems both times. Our fire alarm has gone off in the middle of the night because the heaters, our reservation has twice been input incorrectly, there has been a smell that seemed like something was on fire and kept me up all night checking things, etc. But most irritating of all is being given a quote over the phone by a clerk and when we checked out, the rate was $100 OVER what he told me. The hotel refused to honor it because I didn't have any proof, as in a confirmation email. I never received a confirmation email because the clerk royally messed up the reservation. The manager/s were absolutely useless in coming to an agreement on how to fix this and basically told me I was a liar. We had reserved two rooms and the rates quoted for each did not make sense and it was so obvious a mistake was made but the incompetent, untrained, unfriendly, unhappy sales manager wouldn't do anything. It was a very sad experience considering it really is a cozy little hotel with a fantastic location to my local family.

Reviews.Title: “Most went well”
Reviews.Author: sgschilling
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean. Everyone was very helpful. My only issue was that the TVs did not have a sleep timer. When I travel it helps block out the noise till I can get to sleep. Pool and hot tub were good and breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great option for our family to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: pusserwade
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually choose to stay here when coming back to our hometown of Indianapolis for a long weekend. It is a very clean and quiet hotel. The hot tub is great and our kids love the indoor pool...although it is on the chilly side, but not too bad. During this trip there was a large group staying there for a wedding. We never would have known it. At one point 12 kids, including our two, were in the pool and there was still plenty of room for more to have joined. At 10pm the hotel asks that the kids leave the pool so that adults can enjoy the indoor pool/hot tub area in a kid free environment. At first I was put off a little since our kids are too young to leave alone, but the husband side of me can see how nice and relaxing that could be. I'll enjoy that in a couple years when we stay there. The staff from the desk to the breakfast area are very friendly and helpful. Free cookies and USA Today in the lobby is nice, as are the red apples they have out there in the mornings. Breakfast was awesome. Waffles, sausage, scrambled eggs, fried potatoes, bagels, muffins, toast, boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal, oatmeal, juices, coffee and milk were all available this past weekend while we were there. The location is right off of I-465 on the southwest side of Indianapolis. For those not from Indianapolis, I-465 makes a big circle around the outer edge of Indy. You can't get lost. There are plenty of exits on I465 to get you to shopping, sports and other places. This hotel is close enough for you to enjoy all of Indy, but far enough out of the traffic and inner city so you can relax. If this hotel had fridge/microwaves in the rooms it would be a 5 out of 5 for a week long stay, but it is near perfect as it is. Don't hesitate staying here if you want a clean, quiet hotel with a nice pool and free internet access with a wonderful breakfast! And try the frozen custard at the Culvers restaurant that is in front of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, and convienient to IND airport”
Reviews.Author: thetravelexperience
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week ago on a Thursday night. We had a very early flight and live a considerable distance from the airport so we Pricelined an Indianapolis Airport location hotel and wound up with Country Inn and Suites. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay. We needed a King Size bed and were told upon check-in (6pm or so) they were all filled up. That seems to be the Priceline customer answer at hotels these days, but after a little prodding the front desk agent upgraded us to a suite, which had a King sized bed. The only restaurant that is walking distance is Culver's, but there are several restaurants that you can order for delivery from the hotel. Our room was very clean (still smells new) as well as the bathroom. Plenty of towels, etc... The suite is a large room with a pull-out couch, desk, and mini-fridge. The TV is CRT, which is a little disappointing for how new the place is, but then again this is no Westin or Hyatt. The pool and hot tub looked nice, but we didn't try them. The fireplace in the lobby gave the hotel a bit of a "homey" feel. Unfortunately, we left before breakfast, but the hotel provided a "To Go" bag which was a very nice touch. The hotel shuttle was prompt and the driver was polite. We called the hotel once back in Indianapolis and again, the shuttle was very prompt. The hotel does charge $5 a day for parking if you leave your car while out of town (as we did). Kind of a rip-off as none of the other hotels around the airport in the 2 1/2 star category charge for parking. But, other than that, the hotel is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, but Really Quite Nice.”
Reviews.Author: WXRN
Reviews.Content: The first night was horrible. Our reservation was misfiled under the wrong name, but after convincing the clerk that we were indeed at the right hotel, he found it. We had a great internet deal for $55 per night. Later that evening the fire alarm went off because someone burned their popcorn in the lobby. Next, we found that the bathroom exhaust fan did not work at all. The heater/AC unit also did not work. It was 80F inside and 30F outside. We could open a window, but since the highway on-ramp was 50 yards from the room, the noise was unbelievable. The next morning, we requested a room change and were told they were filled, but they would look into fixing everything in the room. The housekeeping supervisor intervened (Bless Her) and upgraded us to a suite. We've never had so many problems in one room. The rest of the stay was quite nice. The hotel was clean and well maintained (except for the first room). The suite had 2 queen beds, plus a small sitting area. It was on the even room number side, so noise was negligible. The pool was clean, but very cold the first night. It got progressively warmer each additional night, so kids were increasingly happy. Breakfast was well stocked and very good with the typical Country Inn fare. Bottom line is request an even numbered room if you think traffic noise will be a problem. Quickly check the mechanics before unpacking so you don't have to spend a hot, noisy night with the faint smell of burnt popcorn. They had trip advisor signs all over the hotel, so management may want to make sure that the room is useable before renting it. A "terrible" rating would be unfair, a "very good" hotel will respond to problems, and an "excellent" hotel avoids the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could stay another night....”
Reviews.Author: cjwo57
Reviews.Content: I used Hotels.com to find a hotel for my brief stay in Indy, and searched for something with good reviews, a "safe" location, and an easy-in/easy-out location. I found it. The hotel is very nice. The room is quite nice (I'll be checking out in a few minutes), with free wifi, a HOT shower, and easily accessible electrical plug-ins (I travel with an extension cord for my laptop and cell phone charger since most plug-ins are HIDDEN in hotels). The bed has lots of little pillows, but they do squish down and aren't as fluffy as I would have liked. This location is near the highway, but the noise isn't a problem (but then, I live a block away from a train track). Once I found the road, it is easy to access the hotel, but please realize that the street is missing the street sign. The clerk told me that someone had crashed into it, and the city had not yet replaced the sign. The road appears more like a drive for the nearby gas station. The hot tub and pool are wonderful and CLEAN. Most hot tubs seem a bit disreputable and don't have powerful jets, but this one was relaxing. The pool was on the cool side of comfortable but quite refreshing after boiling myself in the hot tub. Service is excellent. The staff are friendly and efficient. Breakfast is nice, better than I give myself at home.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: SueEV
Reviews.Content: manager was awesome, went out of his way to accomodate us; the room was better than any we have ever had; I want to take the bed home with us; rooms were very quiet-never knew anyone else was in the building; the water in the shower was the right temperature; the room was neither hot not cold - just right; breakfast was great, plenty of food and choices; coffee was delicious - best I've ever had; could not smell clorine from the pool WOW I would like to live here!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: sy72
Reviews.Content: The staff is excellent. Everyone is helpful, nice and pleasant. The breakfast was great. The person taking care of it was on top of everything and worked hard to keep the food coming and tables clean too. Which at times was hard as the place was full every night. They also have a nice business center and pool. We took advanage of it everyday. WE had a wonderful stay and would surely stay there again if we are in the area. Also it was very quiet at night too. There are also places to walk to for dinner. Which is always nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great flight in & out”
Reviews.Author: Callhounnate
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of the convience to the airport. Was everything I expected from a Country Inn & Suites. Breakfast was fillling and the fitness center was usable.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LikestoTravel201010
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 with 2 teenage daughters.We needed a stopping place halfway between Baltimore and Kansas City, and chose Indianapolis. We were just "passing through" so didn't want to spend a lot of money. We are AAA members so checked our tour book. Several more familiar hotels were already booked (we made reservations the night before) so we were nervous when we were able to get a room here and it was for the same price as what we paid for an EconoLodge in Sandusky, OH that was a very bad experience. But, this hotel had an an opening with 2 queen beds. We pulled up and were pleased to see the place had very nice "curb appeal", always a good sign to us if they are keeping up the outside. The lobby was very nice with a warm welcoming feel about it. On entering our room, we were very pleasantly surprised; the room was large and clean with coffee pot, hair dryer and a small refrigerator. They also had a pull-out couch, which was great because then our daughters had their own place to sleep. The bathroom was spotless and the beds were comfortable. The people at the front desk were friendly and gave us a 10% off coupon to be used at the bar and grill restaurant, which was close enough to walk to. They have a pool and exercise room but we didn't stay long enough to use them. The free breakfast was very good, with all the usual "continental" staples, plus eggs and sausage. Overall a great experience and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL ENJOYED OUR STAY”
Reviews.Author: jen1995
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the best hotels we have stayed at clean, close to alot of attractions Lucas oil stadium, Indianapolis ZOO, shopping etc... The breakfast was great and staff friendly. We were definitely pleased and would stay here again no questions. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but choose an even numbered room if possible”
Reviews.Author: iowacityia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 3 nights. It is easy to find, just off the interstate, not too far from the IND airport. It was probably a 15 minute drive from the hotel to downtown, via the interstate. The hotel appears to be fairly new and has a very pleasant exterior. Our room was on the 3rd floor, an odd numbered room. The room was clean and spacious. No microwave or refrigerator in this room. The beds were very comfortable. Free Wi-Fi is available and worked well. The carpeting around the heater/AC unit was soaked. It had been raining and there was a strong wind. I am guessing that some how the wind forced the rain in then unit, then dripped on the carpeting. Room to room noise, along with hallway noise, was minimal. But this side of the hotel is right next to the interstate on and off ramp, so semi noise was very noticeable. As always in hotels, we wear earplugs, so it was manageable. But I think this could be a big concern for most people. The heater worked great and was very quiet. The tv worked fine. The front desk area and breakfast room is very nice looking. The breakfast was very much above average and satisfying. Waffles and a couple other hot items were available, along with plenty of other items. The lady working the breakfast area worked her butt off all days and kept everything in order and well stocked. There are 2 restaurants in sight of the hotel. The Brickhouse restaurant and Culvers. A very short walk. My only issue with this stay, was the noise from the intererstate on/off ramp. For the price though, I would certainly stay here again. This time trying to get a room away from the interstate ramps. I believe it would be the even number rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further - stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: djhskh
Reviews.Content: My daughter had a gymnastics meet in Florida and my husband and three daughters spent the night here before our flight. We reserved a room with two queen beds with a fly/drive package. The cost of long-term parking at the airport was close to what we paid for this hotel which included free parking while were gone and shuttle service to and from the airport. We will never stay anywhere else if we are on this side of Indy...by the way, the two shuttle drivers were very friendly and helpful and were prompt in getting us to and from the airport!! Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Moto GP weekend”
Reviews.Author: svassmer
Reviews.Content: I originally intended to stay downtown for MotoGP weekend, but opted for the County Inn Airport South to save money. It was an excellent decision. You don't have to fight the traffic of downtown Indy during a very congested weekend--AND you don't have to pay 20 dollars a day for parking. The other posters are correct--the hotel is brand new and 1/2 of the rooms face the highway. Ours happened to face the highway and the noise was not enough to keep any of us up at night. In fact, we slept very well! The front desk staff was attentive and when we arrived at 3am they helped us check in quickly and said they would not have the maid disturb us the next morning. The drive to the track was short due to the close proximity to the freeway; breakfast was free and had quite a few options for a continental style set-up. The cookies were awesome! Another cool thing--there was a policeman in the parking lot at all times over the weekend. Not sure if this is standard or if it was due to the large amount of motorcycles in the lot--but it was much appreciated. Overall, a nice stay. If I go back next year, I plan on staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: donnadbb
Reviews.Content: We loved it and had no complaints. Just be sure to get a room that is not facing the freeway. This was a great bargain and would stay here again. Loved the cookies they had all day at the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: EmsMomTina
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 year old daugter and I were very happy with this Country Inn. Check in was very quick and the agent was very friendly (maybe Sherman??) We were even ugraded to a suite when I asked for a room with a refrigerator. The room had a king size bed, pull out sofa, fridge w/freezer, microwave, coffee pot, etc etc. Plenty of room for our family of 3. Room was very clean as well as the entire hotel. Breakfast was plentiful...cheese omelettes, bacon, sausage, make your own waffles, muffins, cereals, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, and so on. The breakfast lady did an awesome job keeping everything stocked! Our room was on the 3rd floor and even with several softball teams from a nearby tournament (teenagers) we didn't hear a thing. Make sure to request a room away from the interstate. My ONLY complaint was that the indoor pool was FREEZING cold! I couldn't even get in. Once they warm up that pool, they would get a solid 5 stars! We booked this hotel because of the indoor pool and good reviews, so we were a bit disapointed to find we couldn't swim together.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room facing the neighborhood-- a newer property”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: This place is new. Built just 4 years ago. Yes half the rooms facing the freeway. Hello! I asked for a room on the other side and it was very quiet. Despite some partiers next door, I could not hear them in the bedroom (although I could in the living room). Unlike some hotels, you could actually read via the lamps and lighting. Staff was friendly, breakfast was ok. In short a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: road-trippies
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the proximity to the Indianapolis airport. My flight was scheduled to arrive just after midnight and we wanted something close by that wouldn't break the budget. This hotel filled the bill. Unfortunately, the hotel shuttle to the airport did not run as late as my flight, but the hotel will reimburse taxi fare (approximately $15) if you arrive too late for the shuttle. The room was very clean and well furnished. The bed was comfortable, and even though our room faced the interstate we did not find it to be too noisy (we were on the third floor which may have helped). I requested and received a room with a king bed. We slept too late to take advantage of the free breakfast which ended at 9:30 a.m. However, we did enjoy the fresh baked cookies available in the lobby and the in-room coffee. I had very little contact with the front desk staff as my husband arrived early and checked us in before my flight arrived. However, I don't think he experienced any problems. My only regret was that this was only a place to spend the night before driving on home the next morning. I wish we could have enjoyed the pool, breakfast, reading library, and other amenities offered. We will probably stay here again if we have a need to spend the night in Indianapolis in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay over the MotoGP weekend”
Reviews.Author: MichiganFloyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two for nights during the MotoGP weekend. The rate was $130 per night and we had to pay in advance, but they didn't require a 3-night stay as did some of the hotels listed as lodging options on the race web page. On the upside, the place was clean, the internet was free, we enjoyed the pool, they had SPEED TV on cable, and the continental breakfast was decent. On the downside, as others have mentioned half the rooms face the on-ramp to I-465. Ours was among them and traffic noise was audible, but as a heavy sleeper it didn't keep me awake. Also the regular rooms don't have mini-fridges, which I always like when traveling for outdoor (aka cooler of beer) events. Finally, if you plan to go to the Damon's restaurant next door, be sure to look inside your key holder for a 10% discount coupon. Had i done so, we could have saved a few coins.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mexico15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights over MotoGP race weekend which made the hotel very busy, but still quiet. We found the hotel staff to be very accomodating. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The refrigerator and microwave were convenient and worked well. Continental breakfast was fresh and continually replenished. We enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi which were both very clean. Would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on Priceline, but #2 in Indy?”
Reviews.Author: Marius40
Reviews.Content: The Indianapolis Airport area is a great location for Priceline. Last year, I got the Hyatt Place ($34.00) and this year the Country Suites and Inn ($40.00). The Holiday Inn Select also comes up at these prices. So right off the bat, great value. Other pros of this location include: Excellent workout room with nice cardio machines, free weights and a Bowflex. Clean indoor pool and hot tub. Decent breakfast with frozen omelettes, cereal, pastries etc. Free internet, including two stand alone computers for guests. And one exceptional front desk clerk (Joey Baker) Negatives: I had requested a room with two double beds. I know that with Priceline especially, it is just that; a request. However, I telephoned the day before and was assured that I had two double beds. This was important to me since I was sharing the room with a straight buddy (more important to him I guess) When I arrived at the hotel there was a guest at the counter who was requesting a king bed instead of the two doubles that he and his wife had received. The clerk was in the process of telling him the hotel was full and there could be no room exchanges. I quickly verified that I had two double beds, and lo and behold I had one king bed. Fortunately, they allowed us to switch rooms but it took 15 minutes to do so. This will lead me to the one negative of this location; the front desk staff. As great as Joey was ( I will explain more) we had three separate incidents where the staff fell down on the job. And this is where the Number Two rating in Trip Advisor fails. Service is paramount in a hotel and for this location (though with many positives) to be ranked #2 is cockeyed. The Hyatt Place I stayed at last year was much superior. So take these ratings for what they are, and read the reviews; I believe you will get a much better picture. But now on to the staff. One of the reasons it took 15 minutes to switch our rooms, was that the other clerk (not Joey) did not remember how to check someone in. Yes, we were all new once, and this clerk was brand new, but come on, when's the last time a clerk didn't know how to check a guest in? The next day, I stopped at the front desk to ask a question and a different clerk was talking with their manager (on the phone) about some customer that refused to give their credit card information over the phone. The conversation went on for at least 10 minutes and the clerk ignored me the whole time. Finally, a second clerk (the one who didn't know how to check someone in) came out and gave me the wrong information concerning the shuttle to the airport. Fortunately, since I was leery of the info, we later checked and obtained the accurate information. Anyway, back to Joey. Not only was he able to switch rooms (between the king and the two queens) so to speak..., he later switched us again to a room not facing the freeway. So, when you book this hotel request an EVEN number room as these are the ones that face the quiet front of the hotel. So hats off to Joey Baker; thanks! I gave this hotel a four star rating based on value (on Priceline) and certain amenities, but hopefully their front desk personnel get some better training soon. Cheers. Marius

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stop while traveling”
Reviews.Author: thebandteacher
Reviews.Content: Very clean and nice room. We had a suite, which was very spacious. Ate at Damon's right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business trip”
Reviews.Author: MemphisSalesWeasel
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel once a month and have done so for two years. It is convenient to where I do business and the price isn't bad. It is convenient to the Airport and the freeways. Damon's Grill next door is a decent place to eat and you get a coupon for Damon's when you check in. The rooms have been clean every time and check in goes smoothly if you have a reservation, The complimentary continental breakfast is so-so, but I don't expect it to be great either since this hotel seems to be built around the travelling business person on a budget. The breakfast lady is very sweet, but I don't think she works on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient, and full of extra amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Tallahasseean
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice hotel not far from the airport with lots of amenities for the price. This Country Inn filled the bill. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel staff upgraded us to a suite at no extra charge and provided us with a 10% off coupon to Damon's restaurant next door. Highspeed wireless internet access is now available in all rooms via one of 11 antennas. The indoor pool and hot tub were very relaxing the night before flying out of Indianapolis International. The fitness center is well equipped including lots of towels and water. The continental breakfast includes waffles, yogurts sweetened with Splenda , fresh fruit (apples, oranges, and bananas), name brand cold cereals, and omelets and sasuage. The breakfast staff were very attentive to the needs of all those having breakfast. We were able to print out our boarding passes on one of the printers in the 24 hour complimentary business center. Staff provided us with hot cookies in the evening and a variety of teas were available in the breakfast area. For the best stay, request a room on the side of the hotel that does not face the interstate. Staff checked with us about an hour after check in to make sure that everything was OK and the express check out receipt was delivered promptly the morning that we left.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: niasmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here October 5-7, during Circle City Classic Weekend. We enjoyed the hotel. Easy, quick check in. Room was very nice and clean, even in all the dark corners, behind the doors, etc. Large room, studio king suite. Lots of space for 2 adults and 2 children. Pull out full size sofa bed. Pool area was clean and neat. Went to use the pool two evenings in a row and we were the only ones in there. Towels available by the pool. Clean pool and clean hot tub. Breakfast area was nice and clean, attendant was readily available to assist and clean up after those using waffle irons, etc. Large selection of items, oatmeal, ready made eggs and sausage, toast, fruit, muffins, juice, hot coffee, etc. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My Indy airport Choice”
Reviews.Author: planelite1
Reviews.Content: My favorite place to stay near the indy Airport. They know me by name. Always friendly. The rooms are great and the morning buffet is plentiful with good seating. Love the cookies at the front desk. The elegant lady who runs the buffet is very sweet and she really takes good care of her guests.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience at the Country Inn & Suites Indy Airport South”
Reviews.Author: like2travel100
Reviews.Content: What a terrible experience we had at the Country Inn and Suites at 5630 Flight School Drive in Indianapolis, IN. We specifically booked the hotel because of the availability of an indoor pool and complimentary breakfast. Upon arrival on Saturday, July 14, 2007, we discovered the pool looked very cloudy and greenish in appearance with oil/film floating on it. We decided at that point we would not be using the pool or hot tub. We were very exhausted and tried to go to sleep early. We were on the fourth floor. There were children running up and down the hallways, shouting, jumping, making all kinds of noise. After several hours of this, I couldn't take it any longer. It was after 10p.m. I had to call the front desk who said they would send security up. We overheard the security officer tell a child that it was at least the second time he had caught the kid in the hallway and wanted to know where the mother was at. I assume he took care of the problem; however, we should not have had to endure this for any length of time. In addition, we were in a non-smoking room; however, a few doors down were smoking rooms. The smoke smell from those rooms filled the hallways and we could smell it in our room. Ask if the floor you are on has smoking and non/smoking rooms on the same floor! This was awful. Also, the beds and furniture are all HARD. The next morning, we noticed that there was a sign on the pool door stating it was closed. We heard from others talking that someone had left a present in the pool and in the hot tub and both had to be cleaned. YUK!!! Am I glad that I did not let my children go into the pool. This cleaning should not have waited until morning. It should have been noticed and taken care of right away. I sent this review to the hotel direct today.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Country Inn & Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer_2007_6-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn & Suite Indy Airport South twice over the last week - once flying into town and then again flying out of town. Main draws are the cleanliness and the accommodating staff. We love to stay at well-managed hotels because every aspect of the hotel makes for a pleasant stay. (Think about the hotels that work efficiently in the way that the employees are empowered to take care of running the hotel as if they were staying as a guest, maintenance in order as preventative routine instead of resulting from complaint, or employees seeking out issues before they turn into problems, for example.) FACTS: -Room is clean where you would expect it to be clean and clean in those "behind" or "under" places, as well. Floor in bathroom is cleaned all over and not only cleaned in the more traveled area; tub/shower and sink are also well taken care of. -No sign of mold/mildew on any part of the bathroom. -Sheets, pillows, covers, and bed not stained. Fresh smell on all bedding. -Breakfast is complimentary. Waffle iron is the only noticeable hot food until you see the cheese omelettes and sausage links in the window-front refrigerator for guest microwaving as needed. Well-stocked in other breakfast food areas, too. -24-hr airport shuttle availability makes for easy transportation to and from the airport (make them aware of your arrival/departure schedules) OPINIONS: -Oftentimes see hotels that have the lobby is well-maintained but not the rooms. This hotel has the rooms maintained as they should be. They truly must be looking out for their guests. YEA!! -Breakfast has many choices, yet could even be more inviting if hot foods were all presented without having to warm up the eggs/sausage ourselves. This is a VERY minor issue, however. We would rather heat up our own eggs than put up with a mediocre hotel. This hotel was tops. For us, pre-warmed eggs/sausage didn't seem to matter one iota in this comparison. -The people at this hotel make the difference. Since you have a choice where you stay (and pay a lot of money each night) stay where the people who work there make the difference! WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS LOCATION.

HotelInfo.Name: Country Inn & Suites Indianapolis Airport South
HotelInfo.Address: 5630 Flight School Dr, Indianapolis, IN 46221
